issues.description: Visibility mismatch for attributes: the UML in the problem statement shows the Lecture attributes as private ('-lectureName', '-numberOfInscribedStudents', etc.), and the solution implementation declares all attributes as private. However, the template repository pre-declares two attributes (lectureName and numberOfInscribedStudents) as public. This discrepancy between the UML/specification and the template can confuse students about the intended encapsulation (whether fields should be private with getters/setters) and may lead to inconsistent implementations or style mistakes.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the template's attribute declarations match the visibility indicated by the UML and the solution: declare the lecture attributes as private in the template (private String lectureName; private int numberOfInscribedStudents; etc.). This keeps the template consistent with the specification and the solution and avoids confusing students about encapsulation. If the template intended to provide starter fields, add a short comment explaining they are intentionally public (if so) — otherwise change them to private.
